repositories.readme_content:
# AI Content Generator ğŸ¤–

A scalable, multi-threaded Flask application that generates comprehensive Arabic questions from text input or PDF files using Google's Gemini AI.

## âœ¨ Features

### ğŸ”¥ Current Features
- **ğŸ“ Text-to-Questions Generation**: Input Arabic text and generate comprehensive, non-redundant questions
- **ğŸ“„ PDF Upload & Processing**: Upload PDF files for automatic text extraction and question generation
- **ğŸ§µ Multi-threaded Processing**: Concurrent request handling with ThreadPoolExecutor for better performance
- **ğŸ‘¥ Real-time User Analytics**: Track concurrent users, session analytics, and detailed usage statistics
- **ğŸ“Š Admin Dashboard**: Live monitoring of active users, request statistics, and system health
- **ğŸŒ Bilingual Support**: Arabic and English language support (Arabic primary)
- **âš¡ Async/Sync Processing**: Choose between synchronous and asynchronous content generation
- **ğŸ”’ Thread-safe Operations**: Safe concurrent access to AI APIs with proper locking mechanisms
- **ğŸ“‹ Comprehensive Logging**: Detailed logs for user activity, errors, and system performance
- **ğŸ¨ Modern UI**: Clean, responsive Arabic RTL interface with drag-and-drop PDF upload

### ğŸš€ Future Features
- **ğŸ” User Authentication**: Login system with role-based access control
- **ğŸ’¾ Database Integration**: Store user sessions, generated content, and analytics
- **ğŸ”„ Content Caching**: Cache frequently requested content for faster responses
- **ğŸ“ˆ Advanced Analytics**: Export usage reports, user behavior analysis
- **ğŸŒ Multi-language Expansion**: Support for more languages beyond Arabic/English
- **ğŸ¤– Multiple AI Models**: Integration with different AI providers (OpenAI, Claude, etc.)
- **ğŸ“± API Rate Limiting**: Prevent abuse with configurable rate limits
- **ğŸ”” Real-time Notifications**: WebSocket integration for live updates
- **ğŸ“¤ Content Export**: Export generated questions to various formats (Word, PDF, JSON)
- **ğŸ¯ Question Categorization**: Automatic classification of questions by type/difficulty

## ğŸ“ Project Structure

### ğŸ—ï¸ Core Application (`app/`)
```
app/
â”œâ”€â”€ clients/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ai_client.py           # Google GenAI client wrapper with error handling
â”œâ”€â”€ config/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ settings.py            # Environment-based configuration management
â”œâ”€â”€ core/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ exceptions.py          # Custom exception hierarchy for error handling
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ models.py              # Data models for requests/responses with validation
â”œâ”€â”€ services/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ content_service.py     # Multi-threaded content generation orchestration
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pdf_service.py         # PDF upload, validation, and text extraction
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ user_tracker.py        # Concurrent user tracking and analytics
â”œâ”€â”€ prompts/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ arabic/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ questions.py       # Arabic question generation prompt templates
â””â”€â”€ app.py                     # Flask application factory with route definitions
```

### ğŸ¨ Frontend (`app/frontend/`)
```
frontend/
â”œâ”€â”€ static/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ css/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.css           # Modern RTL styling with responsive design
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ js/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ main.js            # Frontend logic for text/PDF upload handling
â””â”€â”€ templates/
    â”œâ”€â”€ admin_dashboard.html   # Real-time user analytics dashboard
    â””â”€â”€ index.html             # Main application interface with dual input modes
```

### ğŸ“Š Data & Logs
```
docs/                          # Documentation and sample PDFs for testing
logs/                          # Application logs and user activity tracking
requirements.txt               # Python dependencies (Flask, GenAI, threading libs)
run.py                         # Application entry point and server startup
```

## ğŸš€ Quick Start

### 1ï¸âƒ£ Environment Setup
```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/AliiAssi/arabic-ai-question-generator.git
cd ai-content-generator

# Create virtual environment
cd scripts
python setup_env.py
cd ../

# Activate virtual environment
# Windows:
venv\Scripts\activate
# Linux/Mac:
source venv/bin/activate
```

### 2ï¸âƒ£ Configuration
```bash
# Create environment file
cp app/.env.example app/.env

# Edit app/.env with your settings:
GENAI_API_KEY=your_google_genai_api_key_here
DEBUG=True
MAX_WORKERS=4
```

### 3ï¸âƒ£ Run Application
```bash
python run.py
```

Navigate to `http://localhost:5000` to access the application.

## ğŸ¯ Usage

### ğŸ“ Text Input Mode
1. Select "Ø¥Ø¯Ø®Ø§Ù„ Ù†Øµ" (Text Input) tab
2. Enter Arabic text in the textarea
3. Click "ØªÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³Ø¦Ù„Ø©" (Generate Questions)
4. View comprehensive questions generated from your text

### ğŸ“„ PDF Upload Mode
1. Select "Ø±ÙØ¹ Ù…Ù„Ù PDF" (PDF Upload) tab
2. Drag & drop or click to select a PDF file (max 50MB)
3. Click "Ø§Ø³ØªØ®Ø±Ø§Ø¬ Ø§Ù„Ù†Øµ ÙˆØªÙˆÙ„ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ø£Ø³Ø¦Ù„Ø©" (Extract Text & Generate Questions)
4. View questions generated from extracted PDF content

### ğŸ“Š Admin Dashboard
Visit `http://localhost:5000/admin/dashboard` to monitor:
- Real-time concurrent user count
- User activity by time frames
- System statistics and performance metrics
- Auto-refreshing analytics every 30 seconds

## ğŸ”§ API Endpoints

| Endpoint | Method | Description |
|----------|--------|-------------|
| `/` | GET | Main application interface |
| `/generate` | POST | Generate questions from text or PDF |
| `/health` | GET | System health check and status |
| `/stats` | GET | JSON user statistics and analytics |
| `/admin/dashboard` | GET | Admin monitoring dashboard |
| `/admin/users` | GET | Detailed user session information |

## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture Highlights

### ğŸ§µ Multi-threading Design
- **ThreadPoolExecutor**: Configurable worker threads for concurrent processing
- **Thread-safe AI Client**: Mutex locks prevent API race conditions
- **Async/Sync Support**: Choose processing mode based on requirements

### ğŸ“Š User Analytics
- **Session Tracking**: UUID-based user identification across requests
- **Real-time Monitoring**: Live concurrent user counting and activity logging
- **Automatic Cleanup**: Inactive session removal with configurable timeouts

### ğŸ”’ Security Features
- **File Validation**: PDF type checking, size limits, and malware protection
- **Input Sanitization**: Text validation and XSS prevention
- **Rate Limiting Ready**: Framework in place for future rate limiting implementation

## ğŸ› ï¸ Development

### ğŸ“‹ Prerequisites
- Python 3.8+
- Google GenAI API key
- Modern web browser with JavaScript enabled

### ğŸ§ª Testing
```bash
# Extract project structure
python scripts/extract_project_structure.py

# Monitor logs
tail -f logs/concurrent_users.log
tail -f logs/user_activity.log
```

### ğŸ”§ Configuration Options

| Variable | Default | Description |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| `GENAI_API_KEY` | Required | Google GenAI API authentication key |
| `SECRET_KEY` | Required | Flask session encryption key |
| `MAX_WORKERS` | 4 | ThreadPoolExecutor worker count |
| `DEBUG` | False | Development mode toggle |
| `LOG_LEVEL` | INFO | Application logging verbosity |
| `REQUEST_TIMEOUT` | 300 | Maximum request processing time (seconds) |

## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments

- **Google Gemini AI** for advanced text processing capabilities
- **Flask Community** for the robust web framework
- **Arabic NLP Community** for language processing insights

---

**Built with â¤ï¸ for the Arabic-speaking community**

*Empowering education through AI-driven question generation*

repositories.readme_content:
# ğŸ“š MERN Stack Learning Playground

âœ¨ Welcome to `mern-stack-learning`! âœ¨

This repository appears to be a personal learning space for exploring different aspects of the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js) and various React concepts. It contains multiple sub-projects, including a basic MERN setup, React Hooks examples, and a real-time MERN chat application using WebSockets.

---

## ğŸ› ï¸ Built With

* **JavaScript** ğŸ’»: The core language across the entire stack.
* **React.js** âš›ï¸: For building dynamic and interactive user interfaces.
* **Node.js** & **Express.js**: For the backend server and API development.
* **MongoDB**: A NoSQL database for storing application data.
* **WebSockets**: For real-time communication in the chat application.
* **HTML** & **CSS**: For structuring and styling the web interfaces.
* **Vite**: A fast build tool for modern web projects.
* **JSON**: For data exchange and configuration files.

---

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

Given the diverse nature of this repository, each sub-project might have its own setup instructions. Here's a general guide to get started with the different parts:

1.  **Clone the repository:**
    ```bash
    git clone https://github.com/AliiAssi/mern-stack-learning.git
    ```
2.  **Navigate into a specific sub-project** (e.g., `MERN/Client`, `MERN/Server`, `react/Hooks`, `web socket mern chat application/Client`, `web socket mern chat application/Server`, `web socket mern chat application/Socket`).
3.  **Install dependencies** for both client and server parts:
    ```bash
    npm install
    # or if you use yarn
    yarn install
    ```
4.  **Set up environment variables** (check `.env` files if present in server directories).
5.  **Start the development servers** for both client and server, usually with commands like `npm run dev` or `npm start`.

---

## ğŸ’¡ Project Structure & Key Features

This repository is organized into several distinct learning modules:

* **`MERN/`**: Contains a basic MERN stack application.
    * **Client**: A React frontend.
    * **Server**: A Node.js/Express.js backend with MongoDB integration (`Models/Users.js` defines a user schema, `server.js` handles API endpoints).
* **`react/Hooks/`**: Dedicated to exploring various React Hooks.
    * Examples for `useState`, `useEffect`, `useCallback`, `useMemo`, and `useRef` are likely present in the `src/Hooks/` directory.
* **`react/react1/`**: Appears to be an older or introductory React project.
    * Includes components for a `Team`, `ToDo` list, `Header`, and `Home`.
* **`web socket mern chat application/`**: A fully-fledged real-time chat application.
    * **Client**: A React frontend with chat-specific components (`components/chat`, `pages/ChatBox.jsx`, `context/ChatContext.jsx`, `context/AuthContext.jsx`).
    * **Server**: A Node.js/Express.js backend handling chat logic (`Controllers/MessageController.js`, `Controllers/chatController.js`, `Controllers/userController.js`) and models (`Models/chatModel.js`, `Models/messageModel.js`, `Models/userModel.js`).
    * **Socket**: A dedicated WebSocket server (`Socket/index.js`) for real-time communication.

### Highlighted Functions

* **User Authentication & Authorization**: Functions like `registerUser`, `loginUser`, `createToken` (in `web socket mern chat application/Server/Controllers/userController.js`).
* **Chat Functionality**: `createChat`, `findUserChats`, `findChat` (in `web socket mern chat application/Server/Controllers/chatController.js`) and `createMessage`, `getMessages` (in `web socket mern chat application/Server/Controllers/MessageController.js`).
* **React Component Logic**: Various `render` methods and state management functions within the `react/react1` components (e.g., `Team.js`, `ToDo.js`).
* **API Utilities**: `postRequest`, `getRequest` (in `web socket mern chat application/Client/src/utils/services.js`) for interacting with backend APIs.

---

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

This repository is primarily for learning, but if you have suggestions or improvements, feel free to contribute!

1.  Fork the repository.
2.  Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix.
3.  Make your changes, adhering to the existing code style.
4.  Write clear and concise commit messages.
5.  Submit a pull request.

---

Happy coding and learning! ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’»

# ğŸ½ï¸ Restaurant Management System

âœ¨ Welcome to `restaurant-management-system`! âœ¨

This project is a comprehensive system designed to help manage the operations of a restaurant. It covers everything from product management and orders to customer and admin functionalities.

---

## ğŸ› ï¸ Built With

* **PHP** ğŸ˜: The core language powering the backend logic and dynamic content.
* **HTML** & **CSS**: For structuring and styling the user interfaces, ensuring a presentable layout.
* **JavaScript** ğŸŒ: For interactive elements and front-end functionalities.
* **Images (.jpg, .png)**: Used for product visuals, user profiles, and general aesthetics.

---

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

To get this restaurant management system running on your local machine, here are the general steps:

1.  **Clone the repository.**
2.  **Set up a PHP server environment** (like Apache or Nginx) and a database (like MySQL).
3.  **Import the database schema** (you'll need to find the SQL file, often in a `database` directory if one exists, or create tables based on the code's queries).
4.  **Configure your database connection** in the relevant PHP files (e.g., `components/connection.php`).
5.  **Place the project files** in your web server's document root.
6.  **Access the system** through your web browser.

---

## ğŸ’¡ Key Features

This system offers a wide range of functionalities for both restaurant staff and customers:

* **Admin Panel**:
    * **Product Management**: Add, update, and delete menu items (food, drinks, desserts, etc.).
    * **User Management**: View and manage customer and admin accounts.
    * **Order Management**: Track new, pending, and completed orders, with options to change their status.
    * **Reservations**: Handle customer reservations.
    * **Sales History & Profit Tracking**: Monitor past orders and overall profits.
* **Customer Features**:
    * **Menu Browse**: View various categories of food and drinks.
    * **Shopping Cart**: Add and manage items in their cart.
    * **Checkout & Ordering**: Place new orders with different payment options.
    * **Order Tracking**: Monitor the status of their placed orders.
    * **User Profile Management**: Edit personal information.
    * **Live Chat**: Communicate with admin/support.
    * **Favorites**: Mark favorite dishes.

---

repositories.readme_content:
# ğŸ Maze Solver

âœ¨ Welcome to `maze-solver`! âœ¨

This project tackles the classic problem of solving mazes. It's built to explore pathfinding algorithms and demonstrate how to navigate through a given maze structure.

---

## ğŸ› ï¸ Built With

* **Python** ğŸ: The primary language used for developing this maze solver.

---

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

To run this maze solver on your local machine, it's pretty straightforward:

1.  **Clone the repository:**
    ```bash
    git clone https://github.com/AliiAssi/maze-solver.git
    ```
2.  **Navigate into the project directory:**
    ```bash
    cd maze-solver
    ```
3.  **Run the Python script:**
    ```bash
    python maze.py
    ```

---

## ğŸ’¡ Key Features & Usage

The `maze.py` script contains the core logic for the maze solver. Here are some of the key functions that drive its operation:

* `__init__(self, d)`: Initializes the maze structure.
* `find(self, x)`: Likely part of a Disjoint Set Union (DSU) data structure, used for finding the representative of a set.
* `union(self, a, b)`: Also part of a DSU, used for merging two sets.
* `draw_line(self, x1, y1, x2, y2)`: Probably handles the visual representation of maze walls.
* `print_external()`: Prints the outer boundaries of the maze.
* `print_maze(self, list)`: Renders the maze, potentially including the solved path.
* `construct_optional_union_list(d)`: Helps in building the maze by deciding which walls to remove.

You can run the `maze.py` file to see the maze solver in action!

---

## ğŸ¤ Contributing

We'd love your help to improve this maze solver! If you're interested in contributing:

1.  Fork the repository.
2.  Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix.
3.  Implement your changes, ensuring they follow good Python practices.
4.  Write clear and descriptive commit messages.
5.  Submit a pull request with a detailed explanation of your work.

---

May your path be ever clear! ğŸ§­

# ğŸš€ Techlarious: A Full-Stack Journey

Welcome to the **Techlarious** repository\! This is a collection of web development projects, assignments, and learning exercises, showcasing a journey from fundamental concepts to a complete full-stack application.

-----

## ğŸŒŸ Final Project: Full-Stack Blog System

The centerpiece of this repository is a complete MERN stack blog application. It features a React-based client for a dynamic user experience and a robust Node.js/Express server to handle business logic and data persistence.

### âœ¨ Features

| Frontend (Client) ğŸ¨ | Backend (Server) âš™ï¸ |
| :--- | :--- |
| ğŸ‘¤ **User Authentication:** Secure user registration and login. | ğŸ” **JWT Authentication:** Secure API endpoints with JSON Web Tokens. |
| ğŸ“ **Full CRUD for Posts:** Create, read, update, and delete blog posts. | ğŸ—‚ï¸ **RESTful API:** Well-structured API for posts, users, comments, & categories. |
| ğŸ–¼ï¸ **Image Uploads:** Users can upload profile pictures and post images. | ğŸ’¾ **MVC Architecture:** Organized server structure (Models, Views, Controllers). |

repositories.readme_content:
# ğŸ¥ Polyclinic Management System

A comprehensive, web-based Polyclinic Management System designed to streamline clinic operations. This project is built with vanilla PHP, following the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architectural pattern to ensure a structured and maintainable codebase.

---

## âœ¨ Key Features

This system is equipped with a variety of features to manage clinic activities efficiently:

* **ğŸ‘¤ Multi-user Role Management:** Different dashboards and functionalities for Managers, Secretaries, Doctors, and Patients.
* **ğŸ” Secure Authentication:** Secure login and registration systems for all user types.
* **ğŸ—“ï¸ Appointment Scheduling:** Patients can book appointments, and secretaries/doctors can manage them (accept, reject, complete).
* **ğŸ‘¨â€âš•ï¸ Doctor Management:** Managers can add, update, and remove doctor profiles and their specialities.
* **ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ Secretary Management:** Managers can oversee secretary accounts.
* **ğŸ“‹ Consultation Records:** Doctors can create and manage detailed consultation notes for each appointment.
* **ğŸ¥ Room & Schedule Management:** Ability to manage clinic rooms and doctor's weekly schedules.
* **ğŸ”” Patient Notifications:** Automated notifications for patients regarding their appointment status.
* **ğŸ“„ PDF Generation:** Generate reports and appointment details using the TCPDF library.
* **ğŸ” Search & Filter:** Robust search functionality to filter appointments, doctors, and records by various criteria (name, date, phone number).

---

## ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ User Roles

The system is designed with a clear separation of roles, providing tailored experiences for each user type:

* **ğŸ‘‘ Manager:** Has full administrative access. Manages doctors, secretaries, specialities, and rooms.
* **ğŸ©º Doctor:** Manages their appointments, writes consultation notes, sets fees, and views their schedule.
* **ğŸ“ Secretary:** Manages all clinic appointments, handles booking, and can print patient records.
* **ğŸ¤’ Patient:** Can sign up, book appointments with doctors, view their appointment history, and receive notifications.
* **ğŸ‘¤ Guest:** Can view the clinic's public information and doctor specialities before logging in.

---

## ğŸ›ï¸ Architecture

The application is built using the **Model-View-Controller (MVC)** pattern:

* **ğŸ“ `Model/`**: Contains the PHP classes that represent the application's data structure (e.g., `Appointment.php`, `Doctor.php`, `Patient.php`). These classes are responsible for interacting with the database.
* **ğŸ“ `View/`**: Holds all the presentation files. This includes UI components, pages for different user roles, and CSS stylesheets. It's responsible for displaying data to the user.
* **ğŸ“ `Controller/`**: Acts as the intermediary between the Model and the View. It handles user requests, processes data (with the help of the Model), and decides which View to render.

---

## ğŸ’» Technology Stack

* **Backend:** PHP
* **Frontend:** HTML5, CSS3
* **Database:** MySQL (implied through PHP usage)
* **PDF Generation:** [TCPDF](https://github.com/tecnickcom/TCPDF)
* **Server:** A web server with PHP support (e.g., Apache, Nginx) is required.

repositories.readme_content:
# School Management System ğŸ“šğŸ«
## Overview
This project is a Laravel-based school management system designed to simplify the management of educational data including classes, subjects, teachers, and timetables. It features a modern responsive interface built with Tailwind CSS and supports role-based authentication through Laravel Breeze. The system includes dynamic timetable creation, PDF export, and teacher-specific timetable views.

## Database Schema Design

The database schema is crafted to efficiently manage educational data, featuring the following primary tables:

### **Classes Table**
- **`id`**: Unique identifier for the class.
- **`name`**: Name of the class.
- **`grade`**: Associated grade level.

### **Timetable Table**
- **`class_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `classes` table.
- **`teacher_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `users` table (teachers).
- **`subject_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `subjects` table.
- **`start_time`**: Start time of the class.
- **`end_time`**: End time of the class.
- **`day_of_week`**: Day on which the class is scheduled.

### **Teacher_Subject_Class Pivot Table**
- **`class_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `classes` table.
- **`user_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `users` table.
- **`subject_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `subjects` table.
- **`weekly_sessions`**: Number of weekly sessions for the subject in the class.

### **Class_Subject Pivot Table**
- **`class_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `classes` table.
- **`subject_id`**: Foreign key referencing the `subjects` table.
- **`required_sessions`**: Number of sessions required for the subject in the class.

The `users` table includes an `is_admin` flag to determine administrative privileges, set to `0` by default for regular users. Foreign key constraints are employed to ensure data integrity.

![Database Schema](./demo/db/schema.png)

## Authentication

Authentication is managed via Laravel Breeze. New users are initialized as teachers with the `is_admin` flag set to `0` by default. Administrative privileges can be granted as needed.

## User Interface Design

The application features a modern, responsive design powered by Tailwind CSS. Key components include:

### **Dashboard**

  Pagination is implemented for efficient data management.

### **Teachers CRUD Interfaces**

  Pagination ensures effective presentation of teacher records.

---

# Day 2 Report

### **Timetables CRUD Interfaces**

  This dynamic page displays timetables for a specific class or all classes.

repositories.readme_content:
# BONDO2: RAG-based University Chatbot

## Overview
BONDO2 is a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) based chatbot designed specifically for universities. It allows you to upload your own data sources (CSV, TXT, or JSON files, PDFs) and create an interactive chatbot that can enhance administrative and academic support through Intelligent Information Retrieval.


## How to Use

### Prerequisites
- Your own data source (CSV, TXT, or JSON files, PDFs)
- Hugging Face account
- Ngrok account
- Google Colab account (for server-side hosting)

## Client Side
To run the client side of the project:

1. Navigate to the `/chatbot-client-side` folder.
2. Follow the README documentation in that folder for detailed setup instructions.

## Server Side
To set up and run the server side:

1. Create a new notebook or import the server-side notebook into Google Colab.
2. **Important**: Make sure to set the runtime type to T4 GPU, not just CPU.
3. Upload your data files to the Colab environment.
4. Create a token on Hugging Face:
   - Sign up/in at: https://huggingface.co/
   - Generate a new access token from your account settings.
5. Create a token on Ngrok:
   - Sign up/in at: https://dashboard.ngrok.com/login
   - Generate a new authtoken from your dashboard.
6. Run all cells in the notebook.

## Connection
The server-side notebook will provide a public URL via Ngrok that you can use to connect your client application to the RAG backend.

## Data Format
BONDO2 supports various data formats:
- CSV files (structured data)
- TXT files (unstructured text)
- JSON files (structured data)
- other formats

## Additional Information
For more detailed instructions and troubleshooting, refer to the documentation in both the client and server directories.

# ğŸ”„ LangGraph Course Practice

![LangGraph Logo](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:1400/1*Z1NtI1D-YEGBJfb7bW4MIA.png)

## ğŸ“‹ Overview

This repository contains my practice implementations from the LangGraph course, modified to use open-source LLM alternatives instead of the OpenAI API.

> **Note:** While the original course uses the OpenAI API (which requires payment), this implementation uses Llama 3 (via Ollama) and Mistral (via LangChain's API integration) as free/lower-cost alternatives.

## ğŸ§© Course Modules

### Module 0: Fundamentals
- Understanding LangGraph core concepts
- Exploring LangChain basics
- Learning why LangGraph extends LangChain's capabilities

### Module 1: Introduction to Building with LangGraph
- Building graph-based workflows
- Creating sequential action chains
- Constructing agents with memory systems

## ğŸ¤– LLM Setup

This implementation uses:
- **Llama 3** - Running locally via Ollama
- **Mistral** - Accessed through LangChain's API integration

Feel free to fork this repository and submit pull requests with improvements or additional examples using other open-source LLMs.

repositories.readme_content:
# AI Gaming Assistant **Real-time Multimodal Gaming Assistant powered by Google Gemini 2.0 Flash** A cutting-edge AI-powered gaming assistant that provides intelligent gameplay guidance through live audio and video stream analysis. Built with Flask, Socket.IO, and Google's Gemini 2.0 Flash API, this system delivers contextual coaching and strategic advice across multiple gaming genres with ultra-low latency. [![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.9+-green.svg)](https://python.org) [![Flask](https://img.shields.io/badge/flask-latest-red.svg)](https://flask.palletsprojects.com) --- ## ğŸŒŸ Key Features ### ğŸ¯ **Real-time Multimodal Analysis** - Simultaneous processing of audio and video streams - Live screen capture analysis for game state understanding - Contextual AI responses based on visual gameplay elements ### ğŸ® **Game-Specific Intelligence** - **Chess Analyzer**: Advanced position evaluation, tactical pattern recognition, and hybrid coaching/player modes - **Sports Analyzer**: Real-time strategic advice for sports games - **Modular Architecture**: Easily extensible for FPS, MOBA, RPG, and other genres ### ğŸ—£ï¸ **Dynamic Voice Interaction** - 8 distinct AI voice personalities (Puck, Charon, Kore, Fenrir, Aoede, Leda, Orus, Zephyr) - Real-time voice switching during active sessions - Context-aware tone adaptation (coaching vs competitive modes) ### âš¡ **Performance Optimized** - Average 150ms end-to-end response latency - Support for 50+ concurrent gaming sessions - Thread-based session isolation for scalability - Efficient WebSocket communication pipeline --- ## ğŸ—ï¸ System Architecture The system follows a sophisticated modular architecture designed for high-performance real-time gaming scenarios: ### Core Architecture Principles 1. **Session Isolation**: Each client runs in dedicated thread with event loop 2. **Modular Analyzers**: Game-specific analysis modules with dynamic switching 3. **Async Task Management**: Concurrent handling of audio/video streams 4. **Real-time Processing**: Optimized for competitive gaming latency requirements ### Communication Pipeline ``` Client (Game Stream) â†’ WebRTC â†’ Flask Backend â†’ Gemini 2.0 Flash API â†’ Socket.IO â†’ Client (AI Response) ``` --- ## ğŸ“ Project Structure ``` app/ â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py # Flask app factory â”œâ”€â”€ config.py # Configuration management â”œâ”€â”€ analysis/ # Game-specific analysis modules â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ chess.py # Chess game analysis â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ sports.py # Sports game analysis â”‚ â””â”€â”€ __init__.py â”œâ”€â”€ gemini/ # Gemini AI integration â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ client.py # Gemini API client â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ session.py # AI session management â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ prompts.py # Prompt templates â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ gemini_config.py # AI configuration â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ stream_tasks.py # Streaming task management â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ session_cleanup.py # Session cleanup utilities â”‚ â””â”€â”€ available_analyzers.py # Available analysis modules â”œâ”€â”€ routes/ # HTTP route handlers â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ main.py # Main application routes â”‚ â””â”€â”€ __init__.py â”œâ”€â”€ socket/ # WebSocket event handlers â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ events.py # Socket.IO event definitions â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ manager.py # Socket connection management â”‚ â””â”€â”€ __init__.py â”œâ”€â”€ static/ # Frontend assets â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ css/ # Stylesheets â”‚ â””â”€â”€ js/ # JavaScript modules â””â”€â”€ templates/ # Jinja2 templates â”œâ”€â”€ index.html # Main application template â””â”€â”€ components/ # Reusable template components ``` ## ğŸš€ Quick Start ### Prerequisites - Python 3.9 or higher - Google Cloud Platform account with Gemini API access - Modern web browser with WebRTC support ### 1. Clone & Setup Environment ```bash git clone https://github.com/larawehbe/ai-gaming.git cd ai-gaming python -m venv venv source venv/bin/activate # Windows: venv\Scripts\activate pip install -r requirements.txt ``` ### 2. Configure Environment Variables Create a `.env` file in the project root: ```env GOOGLE_API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here SECRET_KEY=your_secret_key MODEL=gemini-2.0-flash-exp SUGGESTION_INTERVAL=30 ``` ### 3. Launch the Application ```bash python run.py ``` Navigate to `http://localhost:5000` to start your AI gaming session. --- ## ğŸ® Game-Specific Features ### Chess Assistant - **Hybrid Role Architecture**: Intelligent routing between COACH (default) and PLAYER modes - **FEN Position Extraction**: Computer vision-based board state analysis - **Knowledge Base Integration**: Enhanced with Chess.com strategic principles - **Safety Verification**: Piece movement validation to prevent illegal suggestions - **Educational Focus**: Develops player skills through guided thinking ### Sports Analyzer - **Game Context Analysis**: Real-time situation assessment - **Tactical Coaching**: Strategic advice for sports gameplay - **Fast-Paced Optimization**: Streamlined analysis for quick decision-making --- ## ğŸ”§ Advanced Configuration ### WebSocket Events #### Client â†’ Server | Event | Purpose | Description | |-------|---------|-------------| | `connect` | Connection | Establishes WebSocket connection | | `setup` | Initialization | Initializes new gaming session | | `message` | Data Stream | Sends audio/video data to AI | | `voice_name` | Voice Control | Changes AI voice dynamically | | `analyzer_index` | Analyzer Switch | Switches game analyzer | #### Server â†’ Client | Event | Purpose | Description | |-------|---------|-------------| | `message` | AI Response | Delivers AI coaching responses | | `status` | System Status | Provides system status updates | | `error` | Error Handling | Sends error notifications | ### Available AI Voices ```python VOICES = [ "Puck", # Playful and energetic "Charon", # Deep and authoritative "Kore", # Calm and analytical "Fenrir", # Intense and focused "Aoede", # Musical and encouraging "Leda", # Gentle and supportive "Orus", # Wise and strategic "Zephyr" # Light and quick ] ``` --- ## ğŸš€ Deployment ### Development ```bash python run.py # Runs on http://localhost:5000 ``` ### Production Checklist - âœ… Set production API keys and secrets - âœ… Configure HTTPS/WSS for secure WebSocket communication - âœ… Implement process management (PM2/systemd) - âœ… Monitor resource usage for concurrent sessions - âœ… Set up logging and error recovery - âœ… Configure load balancing for horizontal scaling ### Docker Deployment ```bash docker build -t ai-gaming-assistant . docker run -p 5000:5000 --env-file .env ai-gaming-assistant ``` --- ## ğŸ§ª Testing & Performance ### Performance Metrics - **Concurrent Users**: Successfully tested with 50+ simultaneous sessions - **Response Latency**: Average 150ms end-to-end response time - **Cross-Genre Consistency**: Maintained coherent persona across game types - **Memory Efficiency**: Optimized session cleanup prevents memory leaks ### Testing Strategy - **Integration Tests**: WebSocket communication flow validation - **Load Tests**: Concurrent session handling capacity - **Manual Tests**: Real-world gaming scenario validation - **Performance Tests**: Response latency and resource monitoring --- ## ğŸ› ï¸ Development Guidelines ### Adding New Game Analyzers 1. Create analyzer class in `app/analysis/`: ```python class NewGameAnalyzer: def __init__(self, session): self.session = session def send_periodic_analysis(self, image_data): # Implement game-specific analysis pass ``` 2. Add to `AVAILABLE_ANALYZERS` in `available_analyzers.py` 3. Create prompts in `prompts.py` 4. Test with real gameplay scenarios ### Prompt Engineering Best Practices - **Concise Responses**: Single-sentence format for rapid comprehension - **Context Integration**: Leverage game state awareness - **Educational Value**: Prioritize learning over direct answers - **Reliability Testing**: Extensive validation across scenarios --- ## ğŸ” Troubleshooting ### Common Issues **Session Not Starting** - Verify `GOOGLE_API_KEY` is correctly set - Check Gemini API quota and billing status - Ensure `setup` event is sent after WebSocket connection **High Memory Usage** - Confirm sessions are properly cleaned up on disconnect - Monitor image data accumulation - Check thread creation and cleanup processes **Audio/Video Sync Issues** - Verify WebRTC compatibility in browser - Check network stability and bandwidth - Monitor timestamp correlation system --- ## ğŸ¤ Contributing We welcome contributions! Please see our [Contributing Guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on: - Code style and standards - Testing requirements - Pull request process - Issue reporting --- ## ğŸ“Š Technical Innovations ### Prompt Engineering Framework Advanced prompt optimization with focus on reliability and educational value through extensive iterative testing and coaching-first methodologies. ### Multimodal Data Synchronization Sophisticated timestamp-based correlation system ensuring temporal alignment of audio and video inputs for accurate analysis. ### Static Persona Modulation Personality Selection system that adjusts coaching style based on gameplay scenarios and user skill level. --- ## ğŸ”® Future Roadmap ### Immediate Enhancements - Redis integration for distributed session management - Additional gaming genres (RTS, Racing, Puzzle games) - Enhanced natural language query processing ### Long-term Vision - Machine learning pipeline for personalized gaming advice - Streaming platform integration (Twitch, YouTube Gaming) - Multi-language support for global gaming communities - Advanced analytics dashboard for gameplay improvement tracking --- ## ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Developer **Ali Assi** *Data scientist and Web Developer* - **Repository**: [GitHub](https://github.com/AliiAssi/) --- ## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments - Google Gemini team for the powerful 2.0 Flash API - Chess.com for educational content integration - Open source community for Flask and Socket.IO frameworks - Beta testers and gaming community feedback ---
**Ready to elevate your gaming experience?** [Get Started](https://github.com/larawehbe/ai-gaming) *Built with â¤ï¸ for gamers, by gamers*
